thread.title: Three Lions questions with Carlos Monarrez: Hope all lost for 2015
thread.title_full: Three Lions questions with Carlos Monarrez: Hope all lost for 2015

author: freep.com
title: Three Lions questions with Carlos Monarrez: Hope all lost for 2015
text:
MORE What. Went. Wrong?
Great question. Unfortunately, no one — and I mean no one — had an answer after the game. The offense and defense came out strong in the first quarter, and then it looked like someone flipped a switch and cut off the power on the Lions' sideline. The offense and defense did not adjust to the Vikings' changes, the offensive line messed up too often, Matthew Stafford failed to pick up some blitzes, and receivers dropped balls. Defensively, only the line played consistently well, putting pressure on Teddy Bridgewater and limiting Adrian Peterson's up-the-gut runs. The linebackers struggled to tackle, and the secondary gave up way too many big plays.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Lions report card: Coaching, O-line bad vs. Vikings
Is there any hope for this season?
As a wise man once said, hope is not a good strategy. There is no hope. The Lions have two games left against Green Bay, the Raiders are suddenly not garbage, and the Rams and Eagles are near the top of their respective divisions. All this wouldn't matter if the Lions were playing well or were consistently making strides. But this was one of the most befuddling games they've played this year. They went from good to bad in a split second and it was hard to explain why.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Up next: 1-6 Lions take on 2-5 Chiefs in London
Should someone be fired?
Not right now. But after the season someone needs to pay for this debacle. Even if the Lions roar to life in the final stretch and win five or six games, it shouldn't matter. They will end up being non-factors this entire year. Stafford has shown no real improvement. Neither has the offensive line. The defense has taken a big step back, and the running and passing games have been very inconsistent. There are no obvious replacement candidates, so there isn't much reason to make changes now. But after the season, expect changes. Possibly big changes.
Contact Carlos Monarrez: cmonarrez@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @cmonarrez . Download our Lions Xtra app for free on Apple and Android !
